page.title: 16THE STONEBOW, LINCOLN.
page.content: The pedestrianised section of the High Street passes through the {Stonebow which dates from the late{15th century It stands on the site of the south gate of the Roman town. The{Guildhall above is panelled and has a splendid timber roof. On the roof is the {Mote {Bell (1371),}still rung to summon council meetings today. The {civic {treasures }include the chains and badges of office. There are the three swords, one presented by {Richard II, {Henry VII's }sword and one presented by{Charles I}in{1642. The main use of the Guildhall is for the {council chamber.}At present the council has a{Labour}majority. Recent decisions have included the building of a {northern link road }to ease traffic congestion around the north of the city and the declaring of Lincoln a{nuclear free zone.
